CSSLayerStatementRule.summary: The CSSLayerStatementRule represents a {{cssxref("@layer")}} statement rule. Unlike , it doesn't contain other rules and merely defines one or several layers by providing their names.

remarks.para: This rule allows to explicitly declare the ordering layer that is in an apparent way at the beginning of a CSS file: the layer order is defined by the order of first occurrence of each layer name. Declaring them with a statement allows the reader to understand the layer order. It also allows inline and imported layers to be interleaved, which is not possible when using the CSSLayerBlockRule syntax.
